greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First difference sequence of A002191. Differences between possible values for sum of divisors of n.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 8 and 12 are the 6th and 7th possible values for sigma(x), since they are sum of divisors of x = 7 and x = 11 respectively, while 9, 10, 11 are impossible ones so 12 - 8 = 4 = a(6) = A002191(7) - A002191(6).
mathematica: With[{nn = 300}, Differences@ TakeWhile[Union@ DivisorSigma[1, Range@ nn], # < nn &]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 22 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, May 20 2003
